content: An object is composed of fields and methods. The fields, also called data members, characteristics, attributes, or properties, describe the state of the object. The methods generally describe the actions associated with a particular object. Think of an object as a noun, its fields as adjectives describing that noun, and its methods as the verbs that can be performed by or on that noun.
stemmed: An object compos field method . the field , also call data member , characterist , attribut , properti , describ state object . the method gener describ action associ particular object . think object noun , field adject describ noun , method verb perform noun .
